overview_of_class: This course will use magic tricks, illusion, and deception to discuss the rarely explored but often surprisingly flexible boundaries of what is physically possible. The topics to be considered include: discerning the skills of the performer versus concealed science; the identification of unconscious assumptions; mathematical, statistical, geometrical, and classical mechanical effects that challenge intuition; phenomena involving metamaterials, complex systems, and chaos; physics of optical illusions, levitation, and cloaking; effects in fluid dynamical, electromagnetic, and quantum mechanical systems; misconceptions and apparent paradoxes.
name: Modern Physics for Nonmajors
subject: PHYSICS
